oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Chet Atkins Interviewed by Bob Allen Side Two
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Bob Allen interviewing Chet Atkins. The recording takes place on 10-31-78.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Chet Atkins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side Two - (0:05) -- Chet Atkins begins a story about almost being thrown out of a building for lighting a cigar. (0:48) -- Bob Allen asks whether Chet Atkins enjoys going out to clubs to see other acts. (2:04) -- Chet Atkins reflects on the past's limitations on country music promotion. (2:22) -- "So you just had to make the greatest record possible and hope some disk jockeys would pick up on it and start playing it." (3:20) -- Chet reccomends speaking to Joe Talbot. (4:20) -- Chet Atkins comments on the "Nashville Sound." Describes how Chet Atkins and Owen Bradley gradually grew the Nashville Sound, but didn't directly try to create it. (5:59) -- Bob Allen asks about Chet Atkins early days on the Opry. Jim Denny tried to run Chet off of the Opry and Jack Stapp defended Chet. Chet mentions reconciling with Jim Denny in later years. (8:24) -- Bob Allen asks Chet Atkins about his work with various radio stations. (10:28) -- Chet Atkins discusses his early love for guitar. (11:08) -- Bob Allen asks Chet Atkins to describe his drive to learn the guitar. (12:47) -- Chet Atkins discusses his early family history. (17:06) -- Bob Allen asks Chet Atkins about whether he transcribed music on radio. (17:54) -- Bob asks Chet if he remembers when he realized that the guitar could make money for him. (23:09) -- "I want to be the antique guitarist." - Chet Atkins (24:39) -- "It was all done out of a fear of becoming mediocre" - Chet Atkins [About studying new music]. (30:16) -- Bob Allen asks Chet Atkins about writing songs with Hank Williams. (30:46) -- Chet mentions that he would often hang out with Fred Rose. (31:40) -- Chet Atkins discusses Hank Williams' drug and alcohol habits. (33:35) -- Chet Atkins describes Hank Williams' melancholy yet witty personality. (37:55) -- Chet Atkins describes his desire to return to the stage. (38:55) -- Bob Allen asks about Chet's personal habits such as golf.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Atkins, Chet;
